verb.description: Make (something) ready for use or consideration.
examples: prepare a brief summary of the article

verb.description: Make (someone) ready or able to do or deal with something.
examples: schools should prepare children for life
she took time off to prepare for her exams
by this time I was prepared for anything

verb.description: (in conventional harmony) lead up to (a discord) by means of preparation.

origin: Late Middle English: from French préparer or Latin praeparare, from prae before + parare make ready.
